docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: As a bone-marrow donor to a dying woman I didn't know and didn't meet until a year after she received my marrow (and, fortunately, survived her bout with leukemia), I received a unique reward: the feeling of spiritual and chemical connection to another person and to life itself.

docs.lead_paragraph: I was very pleased to see last week how many readers understood where I was coming from in using the example of the "Welcome to the A.D.D. Family" seminar to explore the phenomenon of disorder becoming identity. Clearly, this is an issue that has caught the attention of many others, and I was glad to read their insights.
